page.title: 12Communications-River Avon
page.content: The river Avon,which after passing through Evesham,joins the river Severn at Tewkesbury and eventually reaches the sea via the Bristol channel.It was not until 1635 that any moves were made to make the Avon navigable.In that year William Sandys of Fladbury, despite oppositon from King Charles I, began to make the river navigable from Tewkesbury to Stratford (some fifty miles).Evesham benefited greaty from the eventual opening of navigation.The Vale lacked wood and coal in times of bad weather and the road links became impassible.
